    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer.Odometer odo,
          USPoller us,
          USPoller highUs)
        Creates a new Navigation object to control all the movements of the robot.
        Parameters:
        odo - System odometer
        us - Lower Ultrasonic Poller
        highUs - Higher Ultrasonic Poller

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(float lSpd,
             float rSpd)
        This method sets up the speeds of the two wheels independently. If any of the speeds is negative, the speed will be set as positive and the corresponding motor will move backwards.
        Parameters:
        lSpd - Speed of left wheel
        rSpd - Speed of right wheel

      • waitMs

        public void waitMs(long time)
        Sleeps the thread for time miliseconds.
        Parameters:
        time - in miliseconds

      • setFloat

        public void setFloat()
        Stops the motors & floats them. This allow the motors to rotate freely while the robot is still running.

      • travelTo

        public boolean travelTo(double x,
               double y)
        TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading This version of the method exits with boolean false if see an obstacle.
        Parameters:
        x - desired X
        y - desired Y
        Returns:
        true if it reached the desired XY position, false otherwise.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean avoid)
        TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading. When avoid = true, it will avoid objects based on the lower ultrasonic poller readings.
        Parameters:
        x - desired X
        y - desired Y
        avoid - activate objectAvoidance

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean avoid,
            double trying)

      • avoidObject

        public void avoidObject(boolean full)
        When a wooden block is detected, the robot scans the edge of the block with the lower ultrasonic sensor. Once the edge is detected, the robot turns by SAFETY_ANGLE from that position, goes forward a given 10cm (20cm if full = true), turns to its original heading and moves
        Parameters:
        full: - when true, turns away from the object with a bigger angle

      • getMinAng

        public double getMinAng(double x,
               double y)

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double angle,
          boolean stop)
        TurnTo function which takes an angle and boolean as arguments The boolean controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed
        Parameters:
        angle - turn to this heading
        stop - if true, stop when reaching angle. If false, keep rotating.

      • isWooden

        public double[] isWooden()
        This method identifies the block and measures the distance between the object and the robot. To do this, the robot rotates (SCAN_ANGLE * 2) degrees recording distances with both ultrasonic sensors. This allows to detect the height of the object.
        Returns:
        results An array of doubles where the first element identifies the block type results[0] = 1 => Wooden block results[0] = 0 => Blue block The second element is the closest distance measured by the lower ultrasonic poller results[1] = minLow

      • goForward

        public void goForward(double distance)
        Moves forward the given distance. This method rotates the motors by the calculated angle and does not return until the rotations or over.
        Parameters:
        distance - to move forward by

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops both wheels.

      • getLeftMotor

        public EV3LargeRegulatedMotor getLeftMotor()
        Returns:
